 The mdslider jQuery Plugin
 toJSON, mdslider
The related jQuery wrapped dom element cached for speed.
buildDom: function()
This function takes whatever is in data and totally builds out the sliders from scratch.
buildSliderDom: function(sliderdata)
This function is for building a single instance of a slider.
canSetSliderTo: function(sliderdata,
newvalue)
Tests the ability to move a slider to a value
Object.create = function (o)
An Object.create shim for browsers that don’t have one.
The current set of slider data
The related raw dom element that was connected to the slider object.
These are functions that run in the surrounding closure.
init: function (options,
elem)
This is for object initialization, specifically tailored for jQuery plugin instantiation, but it’s not strictly necessary.
This is the namespace object for the slider instance.
$.fn.mdslider = function(options)
A jQuery plugin instance of the mdslider tool for percentage distribution
This is the default set of options for the sliders
This plugin is for distributing available percentages among and arbitrary amount of entities.
toJSON: function()
This is for exporting the data of current selections to a JSON string, usually for sending back to the serverside to save.
